snippet: A University of Washington professor delves into the fate of a Near Eastern vegetable seller named Babylas.
abstract: Article published in German journal Zeitschrift fur Papyrologie und Epigraphik by classicist Alexander Hollmann describes 2,000-year-old tablet on which is written a curse calling upon the gods to destroy a hapless green grocer; tablet was excavated in 1930 along with other items in Antioch, once a thriving city in the Roman Empire.
lead_paragraph: A University of Washington professor delves into the fate of a Near Eastern vegetable seller named Babylas.

headline.print_headline: Reaching Back 2,000 Years to Unravel a Curse
headline.main: Reaching Back 2,000 Years to Unravel a Curse
